question: I am a 37 y.o. male, recently diagnosed with Type II diabetes, have high blood pressure, high cholesterol, and a high thyroid.  I have been taking Synthroid for a very long while and recently have been placed on Metformin for the diabetes, Benazipril for the high blood pressure.  I also take Zyrtec for allergies.  With that being said, I am currently experiencing an intermittent tingling sensation in my right armpit/bicep area.  There are no visible or feelable lumps in the area an there is no pain at all.  Just an annoying intermittent tingling sensation.  It mostly occurs when I am at my desk utilizing my mouse and by no means am I set up ergonomically correct.  If anyone has any idea as to what this may be...please get back to me. My Dr. seems to think it is tendonitis and put me on 600mg of ibuprofen twice daily for 2 weeks.  Thanks.
title: Intermittent tingling sensation in right armpit area only
